isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - CHECK VALVES - DOUBLE CHECK VALVE

svcsubproc.title: Description
svcsubproc.para: Double check valves or two-way check valves ( Figure 13 ) are used in an air brake system where it is necessary to automatically direct the flow of air pressure into a common line from either of two other lines.

svcsubproc.title: Operation
svcsubproc.para: As air pressure enters either end of the double check valve (inlet port), the movable shuttle responds to the air pressure and seals the line on opposite inlet port, but permits air pressure to flow out the delivery (outlet) port. The same action takes place if air pressure on one side of shuttle is higher than that on the other side. It is not necessary for the cavity of one side of the shuttle to be exhausted for the valve to operate. Double check valves are designed so it is impossible for shuttle to block outlet port.

svcsubproc.title: Maintenance
svcsubproc.para: Once each year or every 100,000 miles (160,000 km), remove, disassemble, clean and inspect all parts. Install new parts if signs of wear or deterioration are apparent.

svcsubproc.title: Service Checks
svcsubproc.para: Due to the various applications of double check valves, it is best to bench test the valve using two separately controlled air supplies connected to inlet ports.

step1.para: Install an accurate test gauge in outlet port or in a line from the outlet port.
Apply and release air to one inlet port and note that the gauge registers application and release.
Repeat application and release of air to the other inlet port.
Leakage check is performed at inlet ports by:

step2.para: Disconnecting line from one inlet port.
Applying air to other inlet port. If soap solution is used to check leakage, leakage should not exceed 1 inch (25 mm) diameter bubble in 5 seconds.
Repeat step"B"by applying air to other inlet port while checking opposite inlet port for leakage.

step1.para: If check valve does not meet requirements, it should be repaired or replaced.
Clean all metal parts in cleaning solvent.
Inspect all parts for signs of wear or deterioration. Replace all parts that are not serviceable.
Position new O-ring in end cap.
